info.title: DCSA Components
info.description: Common components for DCSA APIs. Components here are used by all DCSA APIs and Domains.

800SeriesCarrierCode.description: A unique code used to identify non-vessel operating common carriers (NVOCC) for ACI filing purposes if shipment is destined for Canada and AMS/ACI filing is false.

bookingChannelReferenceNumber.description: Identification number provided by the platform/channel used for booking request/confirmation, ex: Inttra booking reference, or GTNexus, other. Conditional on booking channel being used

bookingRequestDateTime.description: The date and time of the booking request.

bookingRequestID.description: Identifier of the booking request provided by the shipper.

calculationBasis.description: The code specifying the measure unit used for the corresponding unit price for this cost, such as per day, per ton, per square metre.

cargoGrossWeight.description: The grand total weight of the cargo and weight per container(s) including packaging items being carried, which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms, as provided by the shipper. Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

cargoGrossWeightUnit.description: The grand total weight of the cargo and weight per container(s) including packaging items being carried, which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms, as provided by the shipper. Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

cargoItemID.description: Identifies the cargo item to be stuffed.

cargoLineItemID.description: Identifies the cargo line item (package) within the cargo. The cargo line item ID is provided by the shipper and is used to define the stuffing. Cargo line items belonging to the same cargo items are stuffed in the same container.

cargoMovementTypeAtOrigin.description: Refers to the shipment term at the loading of the cargo into the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

cargoMovementTypeAtDestination.description: Refers to the shipment term at the unloading of the cargo out of the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

carrierID.description: Unique internal identifier for the carrier.

carrierBookingReference.description: A set of unique characters provided by carrier to identify a booking.

carrierServiceCode.description: The code of the service for which the schedule details are published.

carrierVoyageNumber.description: The vessel operator-specific identifier of the Voyage.

chargeType.description: Description of the charge type applied.

cityName.description: The city name of the party’s address.

commodityType.description: High-level description of goods to be shipped which allow the carrier to confirm acceptance and commercial terms. To be replaced by "description of goods" upon submission of shipping instruction

communicationChannel.description: Specifying which communication channel is to be used for this booking e.g. Email, JSONAPI, EDI

contractQuotationReference.description: Information provided by the shipper to identify whether pricing for the shipment has been agreed via a contract or a quotation reference. Mandatory if service contract (owner) is not provided.

country.description: The country of the party’s address.

currencyAmount.description: The monetary value of all freight and other service charges for a transport document, with a maximum of 2-digit decimals.

currencyCode.description: The currency for the charge, using a 3-character code (ISO 4217).

issueDate.description: Date when the transport document has been issued

dateRange.description: The time period for which schedule information is sent. The duration is populated in ISO 8601 Duration format.

declaredValue.description: The value of the cargo that the shipper declares to avoid the carrier's limitation of liability and "Ad Valorem" freight, i.e. freight which is calculated based on the value of the goods declared by the shipper.

declaredValueCurrency.description: The currency used for the declared value, using the 3-character code defined by ISO 4217.

delayReasonCode.description: Reason code for the delay. The SMDG-Delay-Reason-Codes are used for this attribute. The code list can be found at http://www.smdg.org/smdg-code-lists/

descriptionOfGoods.description: The cargo description are details which accurately and properly describe the cargo being shipped in the container(s) as provided by the shipper.

destinationFilingRequired.description: Indicates whether the shipper will perform the AMS/ACI filing directly or not. Mandatory if AMS/ACI filing is required

displayedName.description: The address of the party to be displayed on the transport document.

documentReferenceNumber.description: A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

documentStatus.description:
The status of the document in the process. Possible values are:
- RECE (Received)
- DRFT (Drafted)
- PENA (Pending Approval)
- PENU (Pending Update)
- REJE (Rejected)
- APPR (Approved)
- ISSU (Issued)
- SURR (Surrendered)
- SUBM (Submitted)
- VOID (Void)

emptyIndicatorCode.description: Code to denote whether the equipment is empty or laden.

equipmentReference.description:
The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.
According to ISO 6346, a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number (composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit). If a container does not comply with ISO 6346, it is suggested to follow Recommendation #2 “Container with non-ISO identification” from SMDG.

equipmentSubstitutionAllowed.description: Indicates if an alternate equipment type can be provided by the carrier.

eventComment.description: an additional Comment to a timestamp that can be shared with the receiver party.

expectedDepartureDate.description: The date when the shipment is expected to be loaded on board a vessel as provided by the shipper or its agent. If vessel/voyage or expected date of arrival is not provided, this is mandatory

exportDeclarationRequired.description: Information provided by the shipper whether an export declaration is required for this particular shipment/commodity/destination.

exportDeclarationReference.description: A government document permitting designated goods to be shipped out of the country.  Reference number assigned by an issuing authority to an Export License. The export license must be valid at time of departure. Required if Export declaration required is ‘True’.

exportLicenseIssueDate.description: Issue date of the export license applicable to the booking. Mandatory to provide in booking request for specific commodities

exportLicenseExpiryDate.description:
Expiry date of the export license applicable to the booking.

Mandatory to provide in booking request for specific commodities.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

facilityTypeCode.description:
The code to identify the specific type of facility.
- BOCR (Border crossing)
- CLOC (Customer location)
- COFS (Container freight station)
- COYA (Deprecated - use OFFD intead)
- OFFD (Off dock storage)
- DEPO (Depot)
- INTE (Inland terminal)
- POTE (Port terminal)
- PBPL (Pilot boarding place)
- BRTH (Berth)

facilityTypeCodeOPR.description:
A specialized version of the facilityCode to be used in Operations events. The code to identify the specific type of facility.
- PBPL (Pilot boarding place)
- BRTH (Berth)

facilityTypeCodeTRN.description:
A specialized version of the facilityCode to be used in TransportCalls. The code to identify the specific type of facility.
- BOCR (Border crossing)
- CLOC (Customer location)
- COFS (Container freight station)
- COYA (Deprecated - use OFFD intead)
- OFFD (Off dock storage)
- DEPO (Depot)
- INTE (Inland terminal)
- POTE (Port terminal)

finalDestinationExpectedArrivalDate.description: The dates (provided as a range) for when the shipment is expected to arrive at final destination. If vessel/voyage or expected departure date or pick-up date at place of receipt is not provided, this field is mandatory

floor.description: The floor of the party’s street number.

HSCode.description: Used by customs to classify the product being shipped.

humidityMax.description: Indicates the maximum humidity setting on the container in percent.

humidityMin.description: Indicates the minimum humidity setting on the container in percent.

importLicenseRequired.description: Information provided by the shipper whether an import permit or license is required for this particular shipment/commodity/destination.

importLicenseReference.description: A certificate, issued by countries exercising import controls, that permits importation of the articles stated in the license. Reference number assigned by an issuing authority to an Import License. The import license number must be valid at time of arrival. Required if import license required is ‘True’.

incoterms.description: Transport obligations, costs and risks as agreed between buyer and seller.

isChargesDisplayed.description: An indicator whether the transport document should include charges.

isElectronic.description: An indicator whether the transport document is electronically transferred.

ISOEquipmentCode.description: Unique code for the different equipment size/type used for transporting commodities. The code is a concatenation of ISO Equipment Size Code and ISO Equipment Type Code A and follows the ISO 6346 standard.

isShippedOnboardType.description: Specifies whether the Transport document is a received for shipment, or shipped onboard.

isShipperOwned.description: Indicates whether the container is shipper owned (SOC).

issuerCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific issuer.

issuerCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the issuer Code

isToBeNotified.description: Used to decide whether the party will be notified of the arrival of the cargo.

isUnderShippersResponsibility.description: Indicator whether mode of transportation for pre-carriage (e.g. truck, barge, rail) is under shipper's responsibility

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

locationType.description:
Links to the Location Type Code defined by DCSA.
- PRE (Place of Receipt)
- PDE (Place of Delivery)
- PCF (Pre-carriage From)
- OIR (Onward In-land Routing)
- POL (Port of Loading)
- POD (Port of Discharge)
- ORI (Origin of goods)
- DRL (Depot release location)

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

modeOfTransport.description: The mode of transport as defined by DCSA.

nmftaCode.description: The Standard Carrier Alpha Code (SCAC) provided by NMFTA.

numberOfCopies.description: The requested number of copies of the Transport document to be issued by the carrier. Only applicable for physical documents

numberOfOriginals.description: Number of original copies of the negotiable bill of lading that has been issued to the customer.

numberOfPackages.description: Specifies the number of packages associated with this cargo item

numberOfRiderPages.description: The number of additional pages required to contain the goods description on a transport document. Only applicable for physical transport documents.

shippedOnBoardDate.description: Date when the last container that is linked to the transport document is physically loaded onboard the vessel indicated on the transport document.

otherFacility.description: An alternative way to capture the facility when no standardized DCSA facility code can be found.

OTICarrierCode.description: A unique code used to identify non-vessel operating common carriers (NVOCC) for ACI filing purposes if shipment is destined for USA and AMS/ACI filing is false.

packageCode.description: The unique identifier for the package type

partialLoadAllowed.description: Indication whether the shipper agrees to load part of the shipment in case where not all of the cargo is delivered within cut-off.

partyFunction.description:
Specifies the role of the party in the context of the given Shipping Instruction.
- OS (Original shipper)
- CN (Consignee)
- COW (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignor (shipper))
- COX (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee)
- MS (Document/message issuer/sender)
- N1 (First Notify Party)
- N2 (Second Notify Party)
- NI (Other Notify Party)
- DDR (Consignor's freight forwarder)
- DDS (Consignee's freight forwarder)

paymentTerm.description: An indicator of whether a charge is prepaid or collect.

placeOfReceiptPickupDate.description: The date when the shipment must be picked up by the carrier at place of receipt. Only applicable when carrier haulage is requested.

postCode.description: The post code of the party’s address.

preCarriageUnderShippersResponsibility.description: Mode of transportation for pre-carriage (e.g., truck, barge, rail), under shipper's responsibility

publicKey.description: The public key used for a digital signature.

quantity.description: The amount of unit for this charge item.

receiptDeliveryTypeAtOrigin.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Origin. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

receiptDeliveryTypeAtDestination.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Destination. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

receivedForShipmentDate.description: Date when the last container linked to the transport document is physically in the terminal (customers cleared against the intended vessel).

referenceID.description: The unique identifier for a reference.

referenceType.description:
The reference type codes defined by DCSA.
- FF (Freight Forwarder’s Reference)
- SI (Shipper’s Reference)
- PO (Purchase Order Reference)
- CR (Customer’s Reference)
- AAO (Consignee’s Reference)

referenceValue.description: The actual value of the reference.

sealID.description: The technical identifier of a seal.

sealNumber.description: Identifies a seal affixed to the container.

sealSource.description:
The source of the seal, namely who has affixed the seal. This attribute links to the Seal Source ID defined in the Seal Source reference data entity.
- CAR (Carrier)
- SHI (Shipper)
- PHY (Phytosanitary)
- VET (Veterinary)
- CUS (Customs)

sealType.description:
The type of seal. This attribute links to the Seal Type ID defined in the Seal Type reference data entity.
- KLP (Keyless padlock)
- BLT (Bolt)
- WIR (Wire)

serviceContractReference.description: Reference number for agreement between shipper and carrier through which the shipper commits to provide a certain minimum quantity of cargo over a fixed period, and the carrier commits to a certain rate or rate schedule.

shipmentEquipmentID.description: The identifier for a shipment equipment

shippingInstructionID.description: The identifier for a shipping instruction provided by the carrier for system purposes.

shippingMarks.description: The identifying details of a package or the actual markings that appear on the package(s). This information is provided by the shipper.

startDate.description: The start date of the period for which schedule information is sent. The value is populated in ISO 8601 Date format.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the party’s address.

streetName.description: The name of the street of the party’s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the party’s address.

tareWeight.description: The weight of an empty container (gross container weight).

taxReference1.description: The identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

taxReference2.description: Optional second identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

temperatureMax.description: Indicates the maximum temperature setting on the container.

temperatureMin.description: Indicates the minimum temperature setting on the container.

termsAndConditions.description: Carrier general terms and conditions for this transport document.

transportCallID.description: The unique identifier for a transport call

transportCallSequenceNumber.description: Transport operator's key that uniquely identifies each individual call. This key is essential to distinguish between two separate calls at the same location within one voyage.

transportDocumentReference.description: A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

transportDocumentType.description: Specifies the type of the transport document (a Bill of Lading (BOL) or a Sea Waybill (SWB)).

transportID.description: The unique identifier for the transport.

transportLocationType.description: Code of a location to which a certain transport event is corresponding (Berth, Pilot Boarding Place)

unitPrice.description: The unit price of this charge item in the currency of the charge.

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

UNLocationName.description: The name of the UN Location identified by the UN location code above.

valueAddedServiceRequest.description: Request for value added service. This will be provided as a list including: No, Smart containers, Cargo insurance, Smart IoT devices, Customs declaration, shipping guarantee, upfront payment

ventilationMax.description: Indicates the maximum ventilation setting on the container in CBM/Hr.

ventilationMin.description: Indicates the minimum ventilation setting on the container in CBM/Hr.

vesselFlag.description: The flag of the nation whose laws the vessel is registered under. This is the ISO 3166 two-letter country code

vesselCallSignNumber.description: A unique alphanumeric identity that belongs to the vessel and is assigned by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). It consists of a threeletter alphanumeric prefix that indicates nationality, followed by one to four characters to identify the individual vessel. For instance, vessels registered under Denmark are assigned the prefix ranges 5PA-5QZ, OUAOZZ, and XPA-XPZ. The Call Sign changes whenever a vessel changes its flag.

vesselIMONumber.description: The unique reference for a registered Vessel. The reference is the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) number, also sometimes known as the Lloyd's register code, which does not change during the lifetime of the vessel

vesselName.description: The name of the Vessel given by the Vessel Operator and registered with IMO.

vesselOperatorCarrierCode.description: The carrier who is in charge of the vessel operation based on either the SMDG or SCAC code lists

vesselOperatorCarrierCodeListProvider.description: Identifies the code list provider used for the operator and partner carriercodes.

vesselPartnerCarrierCode.description: The identifier of the vessel partner for which the current message is intended. This field allows specifying multiple, comma-separated values if there is more than one vessel partner involved.

vesselPartnerCarrierCodeListProvider.description: Identifies the code list provider used for the vessel operator and partner carrier codes. If "vesselPartnerCarrierCode" is populated, the code list provider field is to be populated as well.

volume.description: Calculated by multiplying the width, height, and length of the packed cargo.

volumeUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in either imperial or metric terms

weight.description: The total weight of the cargo including packaging items being carried in the container(s). Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

weightUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

message.example: The request did not contain one of the three required query parameters.

statusCodeText.description: The textual representation of the response status.

errorDateTime.description: The date and time (in ISO 8601 format) the error occurred.

Current-Page.description: A link to the current page.

Next-Page.description: A link to the next page. Next-Page header link MAY be omitted if the current page is the last page.

Prev-Page.description: A link to the previous page. Previous-Page header link MAY be omitted if the current page is the first page.

Last-Page.description: A link to the last page. Last-Page header link MAY be omitted if the current page is the last page.

First-Page.description: A link to thefirst page. First-Page header link MAY be omitted if current page is the first page.

API-Version.description: SemVer used to indicate the version of the contract (API version) returned.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of items to return.

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.description: A server generated value to specify a specific point in a collection result, used for pagination.

Api-Version-Major.name: API-Version
Api-Version-Major.description: An API-Version header MAY be added to the request (optional); if added it MUST only contain MAJOR version. API-Version header MUST be aligned with the URI version.
